I was out in Lorena today which is next town from McGregor where they test the engines before shipping to bocachica.  I got to hear a static fire, lasted about 10 sec, then shut off, followed by another static fire a couple mins later.  Seems like they are adding light and relight into their testing procedures early on.

SN 9 didn't stick the landing...

Yes, really hard to do. But SN10 will be delayed because the same problem was experienced on SN8. Both had restart problems and flow problems.
It may require taking SN10 back to the hanger for modifications. I do not think it is a software fix. It might be tank modification. Higher pressures inside the tanks in the nose.
It might also need a better relight engine. I would revise both to be on the safe side. SOME OF THIS MAY HAVE ALREADY BEEN DONE ON SN10! Each new ship is an improvement on
the previous model, so some of this may have been anticipated. Also, there seems to be no backup procedure. If the flip is done sooner maybe a second relight procedure could take place.
If you have time to only flick your "bic" once, you might not lit your cigarette!!!
